title: Trump's Lawsuit Against the BBC Goes to Trial
summary: Former US President Donald Trump is suing the BBC, a news company, for defamation. He says the BBC edited a speech he gave to make it look like he told people to storm the Capitol building on January 6, 2021. The trial is set for February 2027 in Miami and will last two weeks. The BBC wants to dismiss the case, but a judge said they must continue sharing evidence. Trump wants money for the edited speech, but the BBC says it is not defamation. This is a legal fight about how news is reported.

background_read: This article is about a legal case between Donald Trump and the BBC. Trump was the US President from 2017 to 2021. The BBC is a big news organization in the UK. Defamation is a legal word for when someone says something untrue that harms another person. In this case, Trump says the BBC edited his speech to make him look bad, and he is taking them to court to get money. The trial will happen in a few years, and both sides are preparing by sharing evidence.
